result.execSummary:
The defendant Melvin F. Hardy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Criminal Trespass [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14(2).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
Cases 21CF941, 21CF1225 dismissed and read in.

records.addlTxt: Time to Pay Summary - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward
Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights with attached offer

3:30 pm cases 21CF1225, 22CF747, 22CF835, 21CF941 called. Defendant Melvin F. Hardy in court, in custody.  Attorney Kerry A. Kelm in court for Melvin F. Hardy.  Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
There is an agreement which the defense recites. Defendant is advised of charges/maximum penalties in charges to which he intends to enter a plea. 
In 22CF747: Defendant pleads No Contest to Counts 2 and 3 as charged in the criminal complaint. 
In 22CF835: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1 as charged in the criminal complaint. 
Defendant is advised of their constitutional rights. 
Court accepts plea, finds the defendant Guilty and orders anything else including 21CF1225, 21CF941 dismissed and read in. 
Court withholds sentencing and places defendant on Probation for 2 years with conditions: 
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Pay court costs including the DNA sample surcharge and 1 bench warrant fee in 21CF1225. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
As to count 1 in 22CF835 only: Serve 90 days in Jail with Huber/Electronic Monitoring at the discretion of the jail. All jail is stayed pending further order of the court. 
Parties will submit a stipulation regarding jail credit.
Plea hearing on October 4, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

(Cases called at 8:50 AM - 22CF835, 22CF747, 21CF1225, 21CF941)
Defendant Melvin Hardy appears in custody with Attorney Kerry Kelm.  Attorney Trenton Piltz appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Warrants executed.  Parties request bonds continue.  Court contemplates high cash bond due to number of missed appearances.  Previous bonds continue. 
Plea Hearing: October 4, 2022 at 3:30 PM
Return on warrant on October 3, 2022 at 08:50 am.

There is an agreement but defendant will need to turn himself in to hold a plea hearing. Warrants remain.

State requests a bench warrant in all files. 
Defense believes there is an agreement and paperwork filled out. Notice given to Defendant regarding this hearing.

Plea hearing on September 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
